reviews.text: Just returned from a lovely stay at this hotel. Got a very warm welcome and was escorted to the Club lounge for a quick check in. We were upgraded to an ambassador suite rooms which was marvelous- a large living room with a dining and work area and guest toilet and a large separate bedroom with excellent bathroom. Service was exemplary in every aspect and the staff were fantastic. The lounge is newly located on the second floor and is a huge one which is tastefully decorated. The only let down is the breakfast which is very frugal in comparison to other 5 star hotels in Singapore. I tried for the paid breakfast in the Olive Tree restaurant downstairs but that too was a disappointment. Wonder why the hotel does not give importance to its issue. Went to the Mandarin Oriental for breakfast and I have never seen such a spread in my life! Otherwise the hotel and staff at IC are fantastic in every sense! The location is unbeatable too - attached to the Bugis Street shopping mall and with everything under its roof including a massive food court and supermarket!
reviews.title: A class act in a prime location

A charming hotel, with friendly and attentive staff, I couldn't fault our stay. Would definitely return here again, and would have no hesitation in recommending this superb hotel. Close to great shopping, and a very short walk from a Singapore Sling (v expensive but had to be done!) in Raffles :o)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have always enjoyed staying in hotels with a slight touch of history decor that represents the location. Intercontinential Singapore is by far one of the best hotels I have ever visited over the past 20 years of travelling and I had a fabulous time there. I love the colonial white theme colour used and the decor of the hotel. The rooms are simply a dream come true with bed sheets as smooth as silk and towels as soft as pure cotton. It's definitely comparable to some of the largest hotels in Vegas - close to the largest shopping centre in Singapore and all the tourist attractions. By far the best hotel in Singapore with a very reasonable price. Would definitely visit again!
reviews.title: Brought me back to Colonial Singapore

reviews.text: Stayed here in September, 2008 for 3 nights. Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore. The location was great - it is attached to a mall and underneath is the subway which was very easy to get around. We took the train to the Harbour to go across by cable car to Sentosa. The food in the hotel was excellent. The rooms are impeccablly clean, the bed was THE most comfy bed I have slept in but most of all the staff here are so friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: friendly, efficient, recommended

reviews.text: My sister and I had the worst time in Bali, her purse was stolen on the first day and iphone stolen on the last day, we were in a terrible mood but stopping via Sinagpore on the way home and staying at the Intercontiental was one of the best moves we have ever done. Instantly forgot about the terrible time in Bali, the hotel is so so nice. Room service for desert is a must. The location is really central. The service is really good and not pretentious, my sister and I looked a bit feral when we first got there and were not frowned upon at all. I have stayed at the Fullerton previously and that also was really good, I felt that the Intercontinental was definitely on par.
reviews.title: Luxurious - dreaming about going back

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of a shopping district, as well as government building. The staff is very helpful, and they are aware of the Intercontinental standards and live up to them. The hand-crafted dumplings in the Japanese restaurant are great, and can be ordered in the bar. The lunch buffet is huge, and gives a wide range of choices. If one believes that breakfast is the most important meal of the day, the hotel endorses that, which can be seen by the sumptuous spread. The rooms are great. The Intercontinental concept of Club Lounge is great.
reviews.title: A great experience and worth every penny

reviews.text: A really stunning hotel, beautifully maintained. I love the way the floor rugs are fitted into the floor, so that you don't trip over them. This is where I go for a "splurge", and I book a shop-house room which has all the lovely antique fittings. My husband loved the big spacious desk. Close enough to Bugis Junction and the Seiyu Department Store with its fabulous basement foodhall (great if you like Japanese food at reasonable prices), but also quite central for the historic, colonial district. It is within walking distance of the old churches and Raffles hotel, and close to the Kampong Glam and the Mosque area. There are many cheaper hotels, but this is the place for glamour!

reviews.text: This was our fourth stay at this hotel and it may have been our last. While we have always been very pleased with the lovely, serene atmosphere of the place and the convenience of its setting, right above the Bugis MRT stop, we have never been very impressed by the quality of check-in. This time check-in was so unprofessionally rude and slow for a five star hotel that I wrote a note to the management. After a 24 hour journey we were kept half an hour at the desk (there were no other people checking in) while the receptionist occasionally glared at us and tapped furiously on the computer. No explanation, no apologies. Five months earlier we had requested a rollaway for our four year old son on the hotel website, and sent an additional email (to which we never received a reply). The rollaway wasn't in the room, and despite the reluctant acknowledgement of the receptionist that we had requested one it wasn't there two hours later either. We had to make a special phonecall to make it clear that our young child needed to go to bed. It's a real pity that reception is so abysmal because the other staff bend over backwards to please and the overall facilities are great.

description: InterContinental Singapore, the only luxury hotel in Singapore to preserve Peranakan artistry in a shophouse-style setting, is located next to Bugis Junction shopping complex, Singapore's first glass-covered, air-conditioned shopping street. Descendants of the Chinese traders and local Malay women from as early as the 17th century, the Peranakans blend Chinese art and Malay style harmoniously to create a unique architectural look. Set in the heart of historic Bugis and minutes away from Marina Bay, Central Business District and Orchard Road shopping and entertainment district, the hotel is a unique landmark replete with subtle Peranakan undertones, from timeless furnishing with elaborate carvings to rich tapestry and intricate ceramics. With 403 luxuriously appointed rooms and suites with modern amenities blending seamlessly into the décor as well as a variety of award-winning restaurants, bar and lounge, the hotel is a city sanctuary that delivers an authentic and enriching experience combined with world-class facilities and services for all discerning travelers.
